Brief

Chevening is the UK government’s international scholarships programme. It is funded by the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office and partner organizations; we offer awards to study in the UK for one year on a fully funded master’s degree course.

All Successful Chevening candidates come from a diverse range of countries and backgrounds, but they all show the passion, vision and skills needed to shape a better world.

There are a lot of benefits to being preferred, as well as completely funded tuition fees, access to some of the best quality education in the world, exclusive networking opportunities, and the opportunity to explore the UK’s diverse culture.

At the end of your scholarship, you’ll join our diverse community of over 50,000 global alumni. You’ll return home prepared with the knowledge and networks to bring your ideas to life and succeed in your career.

It doesn’t matter where you come from. It’s where you’re going that counts.

Eligibility criteria| Chevening Scholarships 2024

It is open to all nationals it does not matter where your tribe.

Required documents to be submitted

Please note that All Chevening applicants must present their education documents, references, and one unconditional UK university offer. The time limits for these mandatory documents are in the Chevening application timeline. Use the ‘update my application’ button above to upload them.

If you are conditionally chosen for a Chevening Scholarship, it is necessary to you forward these documents in order to continue in the progression.

Selection updates and timelines

After applying you will receive an email updates regarding your application status at each step of the selection process. You can as well confirm your status on the online application system.

How to apply| Chevening Scholarships 2024

Log in using your registration details. Take a look at the Chevening application timeline  for a better understanding of the upcoming stages of the selection process.
